alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Hall; Howard; Sherman (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 1:24AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Buffalo, southeastern Sherman, southwestern Howard and central Hall Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 123 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rockville to near Wood River. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wood River around 130 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Alda and Grand Island. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 302 and 316. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
